intro: Chitonochilus papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan chiton orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found in the high-altitude regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in cool, moist environments, often on rocky substrates or in shaded forest areas. Its flowers are small and delicate, with a distinctive coloration that ranges from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat degradation and climate change.
